clinical_study.official_title: Reducing Stress With Parenting-focused Mindfulness to Prevent Youth Substance Use

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of study is to develop and test a parenting-focused version of mindfulness intervention ("Parenting Mindfully") to reduce parent stress and prevent adolescent substance use and HIV risk behaviors (e.g., risky sex). The investigators hypothesize that Parenting Mindfully (PM) will decrease prevent adolescent substance use and HIV risk behaviors and intentions. Secondarily, PM will improve parenting, and decrease adolescent stress responses.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Substance Use from pre-intervention through 12 months after the intervention
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, immediately post-intervention (8 weeks after the pre-intervention session), 6 months after the post-intervention session, and 12-month after the post-intervention session
primary_outcome.description: Measured by a combination of self-report on the Youth Risk Behavior Survey and a drug-use intentions questionnaire and urine toxicology and alcohol breathalyzer results.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Adolescent Sex Behaviors from Pre-intervention Through 12 months following the intervention
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, immediately post-intervention (8 weeks after the pre-intervention session), 6 months after the post-intervention session, and 12-month after the post-intervention session
primary_outcome.description: Measured by self-report of onset of sex and risky sex behaviors on the Youth Risk Behavior Survey and a risky sexual behavior and intention questionnaire.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Parenting from Pre-Intervention through 12 months Following the Intervention
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, immediately post-intervention (8 weeks after the pre-intervention session), 6 months after the post-intervention session, and 12-month after the post-intervention session
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by self-reported parenting behaviors on the Alabama Parenting Questionnaire and by parenting behaviors coded from videotapes of parent-adolescent interactions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Adolescent Stress Responses from Pre-Intervention to Post-Intervention
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, immediately post-intervention (8 weeks after the pre-intervention session)
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by adolescent's reported emotions, observed emotion expressions, and heart rate, blood pressure, and cortisol levels in response to stressful parent-adolescent interactions.

arm_group.description: Mindfulness program for parents of adolescents provided for 2 hours once per week for 8 weeks.

Group for parents of adolescents providing handouts and brief education to parents on topics of adolescence, family relations, and risk behaviors. Group meets 3 times over the course of 8 weeks for about 15 minutes per meeting.
